Class WaterWave

  • java.lang.Object
    • Circle
      • WaterWave

  • public class WaterWave
extends Circle
    The Waterwave class represents a water wave that extends outward dealing damage.
    Version:
    5.23.21
    Author:
    Alex Zheng

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      WaterWave(int x, int y, double d, double fd, double vd)
      Creates a new instance of a Waterfall object having its left corner at the inputed (x, y) coordinates with a specified width and height.

    • Constructor Detail

      • WaterWave

        public WaterWave(int x,
                 int y,
                 double d,
                 double fd,
                 double vd)
        Creates a new instance of a Waterfall object having its left corner at the inputed (x, y) coordinates with a specified width and height.
        Parameters:
        x - The X value of the Waterwave's center.
        y - The Y value of the Waterwave's center.
        d - The diameter of the Waterwave
        fd - The max or final diameter of the Waterwave
        vd - The velocity of the diameter of the Waterwave

    • Method Detail

      • act

        public void act()
        Expands waterwave outward

      • canRemove

        public boolean canRemove()
        Returns:
        true if the Water wave reaches its max diameter or hit something

        Returns:

        Checks collision with hero
        Parameters:
        h - Hero
        Returns:
        true if collided with hero
